text: Lieutenant General Leslie Richard Groves Jr. (August 17, 1896 â€“ July 13, 1970) was a United States Army Corps of Engineers officer. He helped construct the Pentagon and directed the Manhattan Project, which helped create the atomic bomb during World War II. Groves had a heart attack on July 13, 1970. He died a few hours later at the Walter Reed Army Medical Center in Washington, D.C. at age 73. ==References== Category:1896 births Category:1970 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American generals Category:American military personnel of World War I Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:People from Albany, New York Category:Burials at Arlington National Cemetery Category:Military people from New York (state)
title: Leslie Groves
